result.markdown:
--- title: "Tidyverse - Tutorial" engine: knitr ---
## PART 1 - data importation 1. Load the data set. 2. Remove the columns `project_reference`, `activity_mob`, `field_of_education`, `education_level`, `participant_profile, `sending_organisation_erasmus_code`, `group_leader` and `receiving_organisation_erasmus_code`. 3. Convert the columns `mobility_start_month` and `mobility_end_month` to Date. 4. Convert the columns `academic_year` to ordered factor and `participant_nationality`, `participant_gender`, `sending_country_code` and `receiving_country_code` to factor. 5. Convert the columns `special_needs` and`fewer_opportunities` to boolean. 6. Is there any rows with inconsistencies, e.g., negative ages? Remove these rows. ## PART 2 - Data manipulation 7. What is the mean mobility duration? 8. How many people stayed more than 3 months in the UK in the academic year 2015-2016? 9. What are the top 5 countries that receive the most people? 10. How many women went to Ireland during the academic year 2018-2019? 11. Within this subset of the data, what is the proportion of participants that go to Dublin? ## PART 3 - Plots 12. Plot the distribution of participant ages (regardless the number of participants). 13. Plot the evolution of the number of participants through academic year for the top 5 countries that received the most participants.
